question: In the reaction Aniline → NaNO₂/dil HCl → P → Phenol/NaOH → Q. 'Q' is:
explanation: Aniline reacts with NaNO₂/HCl to form Benzene Diazonium Chloride (P).
P undergoes a coupling reaction with Phenol in a basic medium (NaOH).
Coupling occurs primarily at the para position of phenol (due to steric hindrance at ortho), forming p-hydroxyazobenzene (an orange dye).
